comment.body:
Hey, 
One thing you could do is install namecoind and resolve .bit domain localy instead of using zeroname.bit.
It will both add some security and help the namecoin network. I'll document soon how-to do this in Debian.
Do you also use this: http://127.0.0.1/1LtvsjbtQ2tY7SCtCZzC4KhErqEK3bXD4n/ ?

> [zmccorkle](#comment_4_1BidR2Pw65fTPeh1R3LbwCdfEJUPB6FLes): And my VPS is out of RAM. I'll wait on the Namecoin node until I upgrade the VPS (has to happen eventually)

Yes, namecoind is very hungry of RAM and CPU. Works fine with a dualcore VPS with ~1500MB RAM.
